page.title: 06VILLAGE LIFE
page.content: Two narrow, unlit, twisty roads run south through Woodeaton and Elsfield respectively. There are no footpaths by the side of these roads.There is no public transport , so the use of a car or motor_bike or cycle is vital.It is nearly 4 miles to the nearest shops. Oxford is the nearest point for contact with rail services and for coach travel. A school bus collects the children in the morning and takes them to schools in Beckley, Wheatley and Kidlington. A few children go to Independent schools in Oxford. Women meet monthly in each other's homes, and some belong to the Women's Institute at Islip. Some villagers go to the Young Farmers Club at Islip. A few people find work on farms in the area, but most work in Oxford.
